column4: hello, easy enuff question:  I have upgraded the kernel many times,  but the old versions are not automatically removed... I have a list of about ten in grub.  Where are the kernel images stored?  Is there a proper way to delete old kernels?
do it in your package manager.
and yes, they're not removed by design.  In case a new kernel breaks things, you can easily go back to the old one.
